title: The revival of the Rosebud bar, a historic artist hangout in Paris's Montparnasse neighborhood
summary: When it opened in 1962, the bar was a hangout for writers such as Marguerite Duras, Samuel Beckett, Jean-Paul Sartre and Simone de Beauvoir. It had lost some of its luster but is now being revived by a new generation of artists.

title: Vance says US wants 'lasting peace' after Zelensky meeting, criticizes Europe in combative speech
summary: The US vice president said he had a 'good conversation' with Ukraine's president after criticizing Europe's immigration policies and claiming free speech is 'in retreat' at the Munich Security Conference. Meanwhile, Zelensky says Trump is the key to ending the Russia-Ukraine conflict

title: OpenAI board unanimously rejects Elon Musk's $97.4 billion proposal
summary: OpenAI attorney William Savitt in a letter to Musk's attorney Friday, said the proposal 'not in the best interests of OAI's mission and is rejected.'

title: Ukraine offers one-year army contract for 18-24-year-olds
summary: This measure, criticized by volunteers, is part of the ongoing debates within the country about the need to strengthen the ranks of an already weakened Ukrainian army.

title: Donald Trump Jr finances the Enhanced Games, a proposed competition where doping is allowed
summary: Through the 1789 Capital fund, the eldest son of the US president will contribute several million dollars to this controversial event, the first of which could be held as early as the end of the year.

title: What is chocolate's carbon footprint?
summary: Deforestation is the leading source of carbon emissions from cocoa, much more than transportation or processing. But the impact varies significantly from country to country.

title: Jay-Z, Sean Combs accuser drops sexual assault lawsuit
summary: The billionaire and husband of Beyoncé, along with Combs, aka 'Diddy,' were accused of raping a 13-year-old girl back in 2000. Separately, Diddy has been charged with sex trafficking and racketeering, with federal prosecutors alleging that he sexually abused women and coerced them into drug-fueled sex parties using threats and violence, which he has denied.

title: JD Vance meets German far-right leader, says he fears free speech is 'in retreat'
summary: Vance, on Friday, met with Alice Weidel, the co-leader and candidate for chancellor of the far-right and anti-immigrant Alternative for Germany party. Mainstream German parties say they won't work with the party, a stance often referred to as a 'firewall.'

title: British government is doing everything it can not to upset Trump
summary: The Labour prime minister, Keir Starmer, reiterated his support for Ukraine without criticizing the American president's initiative. He also draws his domestic policy inspiration from the Republican.

title: United Arab Emirates break Arab front against Trump's Gaza plan
summary: The Emirati ambassador in Washington said he saw 'no alternative' to the plan announced by the US president to evict the Palestinian population from Gaza.

title: Trump flouts WTO rules with his reciprocal tariffs
summary: Countries applying tariffs to US products will be taxed at the same level, whereas, under World Trade Organization rules, developing countries benefit from differentiated rates. The executive order also targets the EU's value-added tax.

title: 'American platforms were supposed to kill French cinema. They are helping to save it'
summary: Netflix, Amazon and Disney are investing in French cinema, while France's moneymaker Canal+ is threatening to cut back its funding. What does the future hold for the film industry in France?, wonders Le Monde's Michel Guerrin in his column.

title: Americans in French ski resorts: 'For us, it's cheaper to come here'
summary: With rising resort prices in the US and a favorable exchange rate, more and more Americans are coming to Europe to enjoy the snow.

title: Ukraine accuses Russia of striking Chernobyl nuclear power plant
summary: In a social media post on Friday, Volodymyr Zelensky said that 'a Russian attack drone with a high-explosive warhead' hit a cover to contain radiation at the power. The Kremlin rejected that its army was targeting nuclear structures.

title: Pope Francis hospitalized with bronchitis
summary: The pope was admitted to hospital in Rome on Friday for tests. The 88-year-old has been breathless in recent days.

title: Apple targeted by French complaint over Siri recording private data
summary: A former employee of an Apple subcontractor accuses the company of not respecting its users' privacy.

title: Introducing M International: The best of Le Monde's M magazine, now in English
summary: From March on, the best of M Le magazine du Monde will be available online, in a biannual print edition and twice a month as a newsletter.

title: Spain's ex-football chief's trial over non-consensual kiss concludes
summary: Luis Rubiales awaits a verdict after his trial for kissing Jenni Hermoso at the 2023 Women's World Cup. Prosecutors are seeking two-and-a-half years in prison for Rubiales.

title: Ukraine: Italy faces possible alignment with Trump
summary: Giorgia Meloni is less critical of the American initiative than Paris, Berlin and Brussels.

title: Hermès takes on Chanel and Dior in the high fashion market
summary: The French luxury brand is a candidate for the Haute Couture Week calendar. More than two-thirds of its business is already in apparel.

title: What's preventing the French from eating less meat?
summary: Researchers have looked into the most effective ways to reduce meat consumption without forcing it. The aim is to make people's diets less harmful to the environment.

title: Israeli hostages, Palestinian prisoners set for release after truce crisis
summary: The Palestinian Prisoners' Club advocacy group said that Israel was to release 369 inmates in exchange for the release of three Israeli hostages in Gaza.

title: For Igor Stepanenko, a twice-widowed Ukrainian, war is proving that 'there's always worse than the worst'
summary: In 2023, a father fled Kherson, where his wife died and Russian occupiers destroyed his apartment. The young widower found a new companion in Kryvyi Rih, almost a 'second mother' for his children. But Oksana was killed beside him by the shrapnel of a missile.

title: Paris names an Alexei Navalny avenue near the Russian embassy
summary: On the eve of the first anniversary of the death of Vladimir Putin's most famous opponent of the Kremlin, on February 16, 2024, the Paris Council voted to name part of the Avenue de Pologne in the 16th arrondissement after him.

title: In Munich, JD Vance declares ideological war on Europe
summary: Donald Trump's vice president said that the greatest threat to the Old Continent was neither Russia nor China but 'the retreat of Europe from some of its most fundamental values.' He did not dwell on the Ukrainian question.

title: 'Whining about aid is not a development strategy for Africa'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, economist Célestin Monga believes that the freeze on American foreign aid could prove beneficial to African countries. He puts USAID's weight in the budgets of the countries concerned into perspective.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'Trump's national-capitalism likes to flaunt its strength, but it is actually fragile'
summary: The United States, following misguided policies since Reagan, is on the verge of losing control over the world. Rising nationalism will only accelerate this decline and disappoint public expectations, the economist argues in his column.

title: Tennis world number one Jannik Sinner accepts three-month ban in doping case
summary: Jannik Sinner accepted the ban in a settlement with the World Anti-Doping Agency over his two positive doping tests.

title: Donald Trump's dangerous protectionist gesticulating
summary: The American president announced he would impose 'reciprocal tariffs,' in defiance of WTO rules. While such rhetoric may be electorally effective, implementing these measures would be very economically risky, for both the US and the rest of the world.

title: Ukraine: Chernobyl nuclear power plant hit by Russian drone strike
summary: For the first time, a Russian projectile directly struck a structure containing a nuclear reactor. Moscow has increasingly been targeting Ukraine's nuclear infrastructure.

title: 'The US's healthcare decisions pose serious threats to scientific progress and cooperation'
summary: A group of researchers, doctors and NGO representatives express their concern about the Trump administration's initial measures, and point out that international cooperation is vital to tackle the health challenges facing the world.

title: French PM destabilized by school abuse scandal ahead of another crucial week
summary: Prime Minister François Bayrou has said he was unaware of the abuses committed at a Catholic school near the city of which he is mayor, though press reports suggest otherwise. He is likely to face a no-confidence motion over the issue.

title: Germany's Scholz slams American interference after US VP Vance's speech
summary: Chancellor Olaf Scholz spoke out at the Munich Security Conference, on Saturday, rejecting US Vice President JD Vance's statements calling for German democratic parties to work together with the far right.

title: JD Vance calls on German right to ally with far right
summary: The US vice president criticized the German democratic parties' exclusion policy against the far right, one of the key features of the country's politics, and met with far-right candidate Alice Weidel on Friday.

title: Hamas releases three more Israeli hostages as ceasefire threatened
summary: The three released captives appeared to be in better health than those freed the week before. Israel, meanwhile, released over 360 Palestinian prisoners. A further exchange is set for next week, but the future of the ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas remains uncertain.

title: DR Congo: UN head warns conflict risks escalating toward regional war
summary: Speaking at an African Union summit, held in Ethiopia on Saturday, UN head Antonio Guterres also said the DRC's sovereignty must be respected, though he did not call out Rwanda, which has backed the M23 rebel group.

title: Ukrainians dismayed by Trump administration's statements
summary: Contradictory statements made by US officials in Washington and the prospect of a 'deal' between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin have left Ukrainians skeptical.

title: French PM vows to help probe boarding school abuse allegations, repeats he was 'not aware'
summary: Prime Minister François Bayrou has been under fire for saying he was not aware of the extent of abuses in a Catholic school near his city. He said he did 'everything I could' when he was education minister.

title: Zelensky rejects Trump-led deal with US on Ukrainian minerals
summary: 'I did not allow ministers to sign the agreement because it is not ready. In my opinion, it does not protect us,' said the Ukrainian president.

title: Mother and daughter die of injuries from Munich car-ramming attack
summary: Thirty-seven other people were injured in the attack at a trade union demonstration in the German city. A suspect has been arrested.

title: One dead, four injured in knife attack in Austria
summary: A food delivery rider saw the attack, according to police, and rammed his vehicle into the 23-year-old Syrian asylum seeker, who was lightly injured and arrested 'right after the attack.'
